content.question: Which of the following best describes how a consumer maximizes total utility from the consumption of a bundle of goods and services?

choices.label: By choosing the quantity of each good such that the quantity demanded of each good is equal to the quantity supplied
By choosing the quantity of each good such that the marginal utility from each good is equal to zero
By choosing the quantity of each good such that the price is equal to the marginal revenue
By choosing the level of output where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost
By choosing the combination of goods such that the marginal utility per dollar spent on the last unit of each good is equal

content.answer: By choosing the combination of goods such that the marginal utility per dollar spent on the last unit of each good is equal
